fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47828].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Space questions do not appear in the Questions Lists macro filtering by recent Questions or unanswered questions options, even if the spaces are public. This functionality only works when filtering with the 'popular' option. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Ask a question in a public Confluence space
# Navigate to a page that has the Questions List macro
# Edit the Questions List macro to Filter by: recent or unanswered
# Save.
# Notice the Questions List will not have the question asked in the public space
# Edit the macro to Filter by: popular
# The question from the space is included

h3. Expected Results
The question should be included in the Recent questions list

h3. Actual Results
The question is only included is the Questions List macro is configured to 'Filter by:' popular
fields.summary: Space Questions Do Not Appear in Questions Lists Macro (Recent Questions/Unanswered Questions)

*Steps to replicate:*

# Check https://example.atlassian.net/wiki/admin/questions/viewpermissions.action

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47812].
  {panel}

When testing the latest version of Confluence Questions (1.1.0), I tried searching for topics from the topics screen.

A few things I noticed:
1- When typing in a topic to search for, all topics disappear and you must hit enter in order for any search results to appear. This is unlike the other search functions in the site, where results begin to appear as you type.
2- The topic I searched for now appears as a featured topic, which wasn't my intention. Also, there is no way to then watch this now "featured" topic without clicking on the topic and then clicking watch from the next screen, resulting in a bad user experience.
3- If I try to search for another topic that I know is already an existing topic, it does not pull this topic up to the top of the topics displayed. Instead, the same list of topics appears in the same order.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47798].
  {panel}

1. Start writing a question or an answer to a question
2. Wait a few minutes
3. Complete your edit and save it
4. Observe the timestamp

Result: Timestamp corresponds to when you started writing, not when you submitted it.

Expected: Timestamp should be set when submitting the question/answer.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47785].
  {panel}

[~mhowells] reported that this was happening in his pipeline plan, and I checked is happening as well in Confluence pipeline.

This build had the CQ ATs passing successfully: https://confluence-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/build/result/viewBuildResultsSuccessfulTests.action?buildKey=CONFREL-CONFODREL-DTA&buildNumber=446

The failed though in the next build: https://confluence-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/build/result/viewBuildResultsQuarantinedTests.action?buildKey=CONFREL-CONFODREL-DTA&buildNumber=447

The instance (confluence-acceptance-tests-dev.jira-dev.com) is healthy, and CQ is licensed after the test run phase.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47764].
  {panel}

h2. NOTE: You can now un-subscribe yourself from Atlassian Answers notifications.

Simply click the "Un-subscribe from all notifications" link that appears in the email footer of all emails that are now sent from Answers.
Some users may find that clicking the link results in a system error message - even though this happens, the unsubscribe request should still have been processed successfully.

============================
As of 9:11PM PDT (16:11 UTC) I have started receiving a flood of e-mail about confluence. Logging into the site it appears you have recently migrated confluence into Atlassian Answers. This has a broken e-mail notification system.

1. I never signed up to watch Confluence in Topics.
2. I have it set to not send me e-mail for new questions in Topics I do watch.

Please stop it immediately.

*Workaround from Norman Abramovitz:*
===============================
Look at one of the questions and see what topics are associated with it. Unfortunately you cannot search for them since the watch link is not displayed. Manually scan the unordered list to find those topics and see if they display the unwatched link.
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/topics

Also, topics that you are watching have a small Eye icon beside it when displayed under a Question.
fields.summary: Many users received unwanted email notifications from Atlassian Answers after migrating to Confluence Questions
Latest question is undefined in topic selector

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47753].
  {panel}

* Ask a question with a long title
* Search for the question in quick nav
* Hover over the result to see the tooltip

Because the question is long, the result will be truncated. The expected behaviour is that the user reads the tooltip to see the entire string. Instead, the tooltip is providing *exactly the same* truncated information.
fields.summary: Useless tooltips for Questions in quick nav

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47752].
  {panel}

I tried to submit a question and got this error.

!screenshot.png|width=600px!

It's probably because I started drafting the question a few hours ago, went to lunch, let my computer goto sleep, then came back and finished it off.

As suggested by the error, I used my browser's "back" button, then re-submitted the form, but to no avail — it would just present me with the same error.

I tried the second suggestion (reloading the page) but that cleared the question editor so I lost my question.
fields.summary: Question content lost after session expires

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47751].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Notifications sent to a user mentioned in a question include the 'Like' and 'Manage notifications' links, like the regular Confluence page notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# With user account A mention user B in a Confluence Question;
# User B receives a notification about the mention;
#* the notification includes the 'Like' and 'Manage notifications' links
# User B clicks the 'Like' link in the mention notification.

h3. Expected Results
There's no 'Like' link in the 

h3. Actual Results
- The links are included in the mention notification:
!https://www.evernote.com/shard/s4/sh/23d2ebe0-b643-47af-82cf-6d6513661cb1/3cefb3058bd938695b80f6a8f0f502cf/deep/0/Screenshot%208/21/14,%205:01%20PM.jpg!

- Clicking the 'Like' link in the mention notification results in a malformed notification sent to user A:
!Screen Shot 2015-06-02 at 16.19.25.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Mention Notifications Include 'Like' and 'Manage notifications' Links

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47731].
  {panel}

h4. Steps to reproduce

# Write an answer to a CQ that contains a link to another CQ. I did it by
## highlighting the text I wanted linked,
## using the editor's link button, and
## searching for the title of the question
# Have someone upvote the answer, triggering an email notification.

The email notification will look fine except for the link to the other CQ, which will appear as the ID of the CQ instead of the expected link text.

It will look OK on the actual CQ site though.
fields.summary: Notification emails don't render links to other CQs properly

Happens in Confluence version 5.4-OD-4

h1.Steps to Reproduce:
# Created a new OD instance.
# Accept demo content for Questions
# Click on a question.
# Receive error.

This occurs in normal instances with existing content and new instances with demo content.
fields.summary: Clicking on question produces 500 error

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47729].
  {panel}

Using the new "upload new version" functionality that is in the Previewer it is possible to upload a new version of an image to question/answer even if you do not have the permission to edit the question/answer.

*How to Recreate*
1. Visit a question
!cq1.jpg|thumbnail!
2. Click to open previewer
!cq2.jpg|thumbnail!
3. Click upload new version and select a new file
!cq3.jpg|thumbnail!
4. Now the image in the question is updated
!cq4.jpg|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Possible to upload new version of image even if you can not edit the question
Atlassian ID profile updates are not working on Atlassian Answers
weird UI when dragging and dropping an image onto a question
Ability for users to delete their own questions, answers and comments
Links to embedded images not working in some cases?
Some users are unable to login with Atlassian ID
User email addresses should not be visible in public instances
Topics are displayed more than once in the topics list
Support "Ask a question" button on marketplace leads to 404 page not found
Double email received.
Wrong message when leaving question page after writing an answer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47706].
  {panel}

From Matt Ryall:

"It's just the normal arrow cursor, rather than a "pointer".

Bonus points if you implement a neat magnifying glass cursor [like Flickr has on their photo pages|http://www.flickr.com/photos/antelope_reflections/10505603064/in/explore-2013-10-26], and make it work for all thumbnails in Confluence. :)"

fields.summary: Ad hoc Workflows throws an exception on every question page
All topic links become confluenceundefined after creating new topic while editing question or creating question
space discovery help tip should not display if questions sidebar link is off-screen
Exception when watching questions list for a given topic with lot of content
The demo content endpoint should never create the demo content twice
ReputationChangedEvent is not published when bounties are awarded

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47694].
  {panel}

I observed to erroneous behaviors in Answers, but I couldn't determine the cause of them. They are not reproducible, it seems to happen randomly.

# First I filtered by *Unanswered* questions. Among the results I could see a few questions which already had 1 answer on them. The thing in common these already answered questions had is that they didn't have upvotes (so my first tought was that Answers was also listing answered questions that just didn't receive any upvotes). I couldn't reproduce this.
# After, filtering by *Recent* questions, I was seeing a list with questions created up to 3 hours ago, and then suddenly questions created in January 2014 (many months before, considering today is September 24) and older. For this I took a screenshot:
!answersrecent.png|thumbnail!
For this one I was able to refresh the page and reproduce this.
fields.summary: Wrong questions listed for specific filters

See the attached screenshot:

I was mentioned in a comment on an answer.  The email generated a hyperlink to:

fields.summary: Notifications when being mentioned in a comment generate an incorrect link to the original content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47683].
  {panel}

*Steps to replicate*
# Ensure your current user has posted an Answer in Confluence Questions with topics
# Go to user Profile (click on your Profile Picture > Profile)
# At the section Expertise, find the label/topic under Most answered topics
# Click on one of them

*Observation*
User will be redirected to Page Not Found. The URL shows "<baseURL>/users/null"

*Workaround*
Go to "<baseURL>/questions/topics" and search manually
fields.summary: Page Not Found When Clicking Most Answered Topics in User Profile

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-47668].
  {panel}

When a question has been answered the display does not currently show that it has been answered. The "green check" icon is the indicator that an answer has been accepted, however, we believe that the user experience would be improved if the display included one or all of the following enhancements:

1. An indicator that someone has answered the question even if it has not yet been accepted.

2. An excerpt of the answer (first few words or first line of the answer).

3. A mention (@username) of the accepted answer's user name.

Please advise as to the feasibility of these requested enhancements and the turnaround time.

Thank you!
fields.summary: Displaying an excerpt of the answer when a question has been answered, or showing who's answer has been accepted.
